intro: Johnsonia stawellii, commonly known as the Stawell Johnsonia, is a rare and unique plant species native to the arid regions of South Australia. It is characterized by its distinctive, spiky leaves and small, pale yellow flowers that bloom during the cooler months. The plant thrives in well-drained soils and requires minimal water, making it well-adapted to its harsh environment. Its conservation status is vulnerable due to habitat loss and limited distribution. Johnsonia stawellii plays an important ecological role in its native ecosystem, supporting local insect populations and contributing to biodiversity.
